category: Member sport group regulations/Article 23 (Restrictions on concurrent positions for executives)
contents: Article 23 (Restrictions on holding concurrent positions for officers) ① Representatives and executives of a member sport organization cannot concurrently serve as delegates or executives of another member sport organization. However, in the case of modern pentathlon, biathlon, triathlon, luge, bobsleigh, skeleton, and underwater/fin swimming, executives from other member event organizations may be appointed if the general meeting of the member event organization decides that it is necessary to foster the relevant event. there is. Revised 2017. 8. 7., 2018. 4. 25., 2021. 10. 6. ② If an executive of a member sport organization wishes to become a candidate for election as president of another member sport organization, the current member shall be eligible until the day before candidate registration begins. You must resign from your position as an executive of a sports organization. Revised on April 25, 2018, October 6, 2021. ③ Among the executives of member sports organizations, accounting auditors may concurrently serve as auditors of other sports organizations. ④ An executive of a city/provincial sports organization of a member sports organization cannot concurrently serve as an executive of another city/provincial sports organization of the relevant sports organization. Newly established 2022. 12. 26. [Title revised 2021. 10. 6.]
